contentrichtext.text: {{Politics of Namibia}} The [[Subnational|administrative]] division of [[Namibia]] is tabled by ''Delimitation Commissions'' and accepted or declined by the [[National Assembly of Namibia|National Assembly]]. The First Delimitation Commission chaired by Judge President [[Johan Strydom]] suggested in 1992 that Namibia be divided into 13 Regions, a number that has not been amended since.<ref>{{cite book |title=Focus on: Khomas Region |chapter=Khomas Region, a constitutional, political and geographical hybrid |last=Matundu-Tjiparuro |first=Mae |publisher=supplement to [[New Era (Namibia)|New Era]] |page=3 |date=28 February 2011}}</ref> {| class=wikitable ! # !! '''Region''' !! '''Capital''' !! '''Population (2011)'''<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.namibian.com.na/news-articles/national/full-story/archive/2012/april/article/namibias-population-hits-21-million/ |title=Namibia’s population hits 2,1 million |last=Smit |first=Nico |date=12 April 2012 |work=[[The Namibian]]}}</ref><ref name=ElectionWatch>{{cite journal |year=2013 |title=Namibia's Population by Region |journal=Election Watch |publisher=Institute for Public Policy Research |issue=1 |page=3}}</ref> !! '''Area (km²)'''<ref name=ElectionWatch/> !!
